statement.tex: %text A torpedo boat is anchored 9 km away from the nearest point $(A)$ on a shore. A messenger must be sent from the torpedo boat to a camp that is 15 km away from $A$ along the shore. If a messenger can walk at 5 km/h and row at 4 km/h, then where on the shore must he land in order to reach the camp in the shortest possible time? %

\\ %text Does the figure below correctly describe the situation? The boat is at B and the camp is at C. \textbf{Note: } \underline\text{x} is the distance from the nearest point (A) to where the boat lands (X) %
\\ %text If the total time taken $ = T = T_R + T_W$ where, $T_R = $ time spent rowing and $T_W = $ time spent walking, then \underline\text{which of the following is true}? %

reason.tex: %text The boat is anchored 9 km away from the nearest point A. Hence, AB = 9 km. And as the camp is 15 km away from A, therefore AC = 15 km. %

%text \textbf{Remember, }we want to find the minimum time taken. And time = $\dfrac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}}$. Hence, % \begin{align} T &= \underbrace{\dfrac{\sqrt{x^2 + 9^2}}{4}}_{T_R = \frac{BX}{4 km/h}} + \underbrace{\dfrac{15-x}{5}}_{T_W = \frac{CX}{5 km/h}} \\ \implies\dfrac{dT}{dx} &= \dfrac{2x}{4\cdot 2\sqrt{x^2+81}} - \dfrac{1}{5} \\ \text{And if }\dfrac{dT}{dx} &=0\text{ then } \dfrac{x}{4\sqrt{x^2+ 81}} = \dfrac{1}{5}\\ \implies 25 x^2 &= 16\cdot (x^2 + 81) \text{ or } x^2 = \dfrac{81\times 16}{9} \\ \implies x &= \sqrt{\dfrac{81\times 16}{9}} = 12\text{ km.} \end{align}

options.tex: \textbf{No. The friend is wrong.} \\ \quad\dfrac{d^2 T}{dx^2} \gt 0\implies \text{ minima at x = 12 km.}

reason.tex:
\begin{align} \dfrac{dT}{dx} &= \dfrac{x}{4\sqrt{x^2+81}} - \dfrac{1}{5} \\ \implies \dfrac{d^2T}{dx^2} &= \underbrace{\dfrac{1}{4}\cdot \left[\dfrac{\sqrt{x^2+81} - \frac{x\cdot 2x}{2\sqrt{x^2+81}}}{(x^2+81)}\right]} _{\frac{d}{dx}\frac{f(x)}{g(x)} = \frac{gf'-fg'}{g^2}} \\ &= \dfrac{81}{4\cdot (x^2+81)^\frac{3}{2}} \gt 0\text{ for x = 12.} \end{align} \\ %text
Hence, not only does T have an extreme value when x = 12 km, that value is also a minimum.
Hence, the \underline\text{boat must land 12 km from A} or $(15-x) = 3$ km from the camp (C). %

choices.tex: \text{In the middle - 7.5 km from the camp.}
